parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.VISIT

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: VISIT
fields.questionText: What is the visit name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date that the Microbiology Specimen was collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the Microbiology Findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the Microbiology Findings CRF using the date (MBDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether or not microbiology examination performed.
fields.definition: An indication of whether or not a planned measurement, series of measurements, test, or observation was performed or specimen was collected.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be implemented for an entire panel. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
fields.label: Microbiology Sampling Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MBSTAT. If MBPERF="N", the value of MBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MBPERF="Y", MBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MBCAT and MBSCAT, MBTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MBTESTCD would be populated as MBALL and an appropriate test name (MBTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.
fields.name: MBPERF
fields.questionText: Was the microbiology examination performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBREFID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the specimen [accession/reference] number assigned.
fields.definition: An internal or external identifier such as specimen identifier.
fields.implementationNotes: This can be used to reconcile CRF data. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).
fields.label: MB Reference ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: MBREFID
fields.questionText: What was the (microbiology test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBSPID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
fields.implementationNotes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: MB Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: MBSPID
fields.questionText: [Sponsor-defined question]

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBGRPID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each microbiology specimen or result record has a unique identifier that will link records across domains.
fields.definition: A group identifier used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
fields.implementationNotes: SDTMIG v3.2 uses --GRPID as the variable that links the Microbiology Specimen/Result domain (MB) with the Microbiology Susceptibility domain (MS). In RELREC, this one-to-many relationship may be represented with a simple 2-record dataset-to-dataset RELREC.
fields.label: MB Group ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: MBGRPID
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the [test/procedure/observation] group identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBLNKID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each microbiology specimen or result record has a unique identifier that will link records across domains.
fields.definition: An identifier used to link related records across domains.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. For example, a single microbiology specimen or result may have multiple measurements/assessments performed (e.g., susceptibility testing).
fields.label: MB Link ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTM Target". May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: MBLNKID
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the [test/procedure/observation] link identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date of specimen collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.
fields.label: MB Specimen Collection Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: MBDAT
fields.questionText: What was the (start) date of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record time of collection (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on one day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.
fields.label: MB Specimen Collection Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: MBTIM
fields.questionText: What was the (start) time of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the microscopic finding category, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: MB Category for Microbiology Finding
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: MBCAT
fields.questionText: What was the category of the Microbiology finding?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the microscopic finding subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the MBCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. MBSCAT can only be used if there is an MBCAT and it must be a subcategorization of MBCAT.
fields.label: MB Subcategory for Microbiology Finding
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: MBSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the subcategory of the Microbiology finding?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C120528

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBTEST

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Microbiology Test or Finding Short Name

fields.completionInstructions: Record the type or name of the microscopic examination, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Descriptive name of the Microbiology test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
fields.implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Microbiology Test or Finding Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable MBTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in MBTEST. Both MBTESTCD and MBTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: MBTEST
fields.questionText: What was the Microbiology examination test name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBTSTDTL

fields.completionInstructions: Record the detail of the microbiology examination, if not preprinted on the CRF.
fields.definition: Detail of the Microbiology examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
fields.implementationNotes: Provides additional details for the microbiology examination. It is recommended that the test detail be preprinted on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test Detail" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Microbiology Examination Detail
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: MBTSTDTL
fields.questionText: What was the Microbiology examination detail?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBORRES

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

self.title: MB Result or Finding in Original Units

fields.completionInstructions: Record test result, interpretation or finding.
fields.definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.
fields.label: MB Result or Finding in Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: MBORRES
fields.questionText: What was the result of the examination?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBORRESU

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.
fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere. For some tests the units may not be applicable (e.g., where MBTEST="Microbial Organism Identification").
fields.label: MB Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: MBORRESU
fields.questionText: What was the unit of the result?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBCLSIG

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether the results were clinically significant.
fields.definition: An indication whether the test results were clinically significant.
fields.label: MB Clinical Significance
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPMB dataset as the value of SUPPMB.QVAL where SUPPMB.QNAM = "MBCLSIG" and SUPPMB.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: MBCLSIG
fields.questionText: Was the result clinically significant?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBRESCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the category of the test results.
fields.definition: Used to categorize the result of a finding.
fields.implementationNotes: Used to categorize the results of a finding (e.g., INFECTING, COLONIZER).
fields.label: MB Result Category
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: MBRESCAT
fields.questionText: What was the result category?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBNAM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the laboratory name.
fields.definition: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.
fields.implementationNotes: Recommended to collect on the CRF if lab names was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple labs are used by a site.
fields.label: MB Vendor Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: MBNAM
fields.questionText: What was the name of the vendor used?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78734

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBSPEC

fields.completionInstructions: Record the specimen material type.
fields.definition: The type of specimen used for a measurement.
fields.implementationNotes: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.
fields.label: MB Specimen Type
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: MBSPEC
fields.questionText: What is the specimen material type?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78733

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBSPCCND

fields.completionInstructions: Record condition of specimen.
fields.definition: Describes the condition of the specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.
fields.label: MB Specimen Condition
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: MBSPCCND
fields.questionText: What was the condition of the specimen?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBLOC

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.
fields.definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: MB Specimen Collection Location
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: MBLOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location where the specimen was collected?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBLAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.
fields.implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: MB Specimen Collection Laterality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: MBLAT
fields.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBDIR

fields.completionInstructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.
fields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: MB Specimen Collection Directionality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: MBDIR
fields.questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C85492

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBMETHOD

self.title: MB Method of Test or Examination

fields.completionInstructions: Record the method of test or examination.
fields.definition: Method of the test or examination.
fields.implementationNotes: This information may be collected when more than one method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary. This could include technique or type of staining used for the slides.
fields.label: MB Method of Test or Examination
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: MBMETHOD
fields.questionText: What was the method used for the test or examination?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field MB.LocalProcessing.MBEVAL

fields.completionInstructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
fields.definition: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.
fields.implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: MB Evaluator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: MBEVAL
fields.questionText: Who was the evaluator?
